document.masterDocTitle: Thirteen new species of the spider genus Karaops (Araneae: Selenopidae) from Western Australia

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Thirteen new species of the spider genus Karaops (Araneae: Selenopidae) from Western Australia

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material.
Holotype : female, 2.3 km ESE of Python Pool, SITE PW01 [ 21 ˚ 20 ’ 22.8 ” S 117 ˚ 15 ’ 36.3 ” E, Western Australia , Australia ],
16 July 2003
–
11 October 2004
, CALM PILBARA SURVEY, ethylene glycol pitfalls (WAM T 79403 ).

Paratype :
1 male
, same data as holotype , (WAM T 79403 ).

Other material examined. AUSTRALIA :
Western Australia
: 2 penultimate males, 5 immatures, same data as holotype and paratype (WAM T 79403 ).

Etymology. The specific epithet refers to the indigenous Yindjibarndi word for Python Pool, the type locality. Yindjibarndi is the language indigenous to the type locality. This name is to be treated as a noun in apposition.

Diagnosis. Females of
K. yurlburr
sp. nov.
can be distinguished from all other species by the epigyne, which has a large medial depression, with the copulatory openings located laterally and the lateral lobes pointed posteriorly (
Figs 9–10
). Males of
K. yurlburr
sp. nov.
can be distinguished from all other species by having only 2 prolateral teeth and an RTA in which the dorsal branch is much longer than the ventral branch (
Figs 11–12
).
Description. Female ( holotype ):

Colour. Dorsal shield of prosoma uniformly yellow-brown; sternum pale yellow-brown; chelicerae pale yellow with darker infuscations anteriorly; maxillae pale yellow; labium pale brown, lightening distally; opisthosoma dorsally yellow-brown with darker markings; ventrally pale yellow-brown; legs yellow brown with darker annulations, legs darkening distally.
Prosoma. 0.90 times longer than broad; clypeus 0.18 high.

Eyes. AER slightly recurved; PER recurved; PME larger than AME, PLE largest, ALE smallest; eye group width 1.23 ; eye diameters, AME 0.20 , ALE 0.11 , PME 0.29 , PLE 0.36 ; interdistances AME-ALE 0.38 , PME-PLE 0.36 , ALE-PLE 0.25 , AME-PME 0.02 ; ocular quadrangle AME-AME 0.13 , PME-PME 0.45 .
Sternum. 0.80 times longer than broad.
Chelicerae. Promargin with 3 teeth, retromargin with 2 teeth.
Female pedipalp. Claw with ca. 6 teeth.
Opisthosoma. Unclear if caudal setal tufts are present because the opisthosoma is damaged.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 9–14.
Karaops yurlburr
sp. nov.
9 epigyne; 10 vulva; 11–12 left pedipalp (11 ventral, 12 retrolateral view).
Karaops feedtime
sp. nov.
13 epigyne; 14 vulva. Scales: 0.50 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Legs. Leg I slightly shorter than II and III; leg formula unknown (at least one leg missing); leg III longest; tarsal claws without teeth; spination: leg I, Fm pr 1 - 1 - 1 , d 1 - 1 - 1 , rl 0; Ti d 0,
v 2 - 2
- 2 - 2 - 2 ; Mt
v 2 - 2
- 2 - 2 ; leg II, Fm pr 0- 0-1 , d 1 - 1 - 1 , rl 0; Ti
v 2 - 2
- 2 - 2 - 2 ; Mt
v 2 - 2
- 2 - 2 ; leg III, Fm pr 0- 0-1 , d 1 - 1 - 1 , rl 0; Ti
v 1 - 1
-0; Mt
v 2
-0.

Measurements. Total length 8.34 . Dorsal shield of prosoma length 3.20 , width 3.56 . Sternum length 1.36 , width 1.70 . Opisthosoma length 5.14 , width 3.90 . Pedipalp: Fm 0.89 , Pt 0.55 , Ti 0.63 , Ta 0.71 , (total) 2.78 . Leg I: Fm 3.25 , Pt 1.30 , Ti 2.93 , Mt 2.39 , Ta 1.09 , (total) 10.96 . Leg II: Fm 4.05 , Pt 1.32 , tibia 3.11 , Mt 2.68 , Ta 1.16 , (total) 12.32 . Leg III: Fm 4.42 , Pt 1.46 , Ti 3.08 , Mt 2.93 , Ta 1.29 , (total) 13.18 . Leg IV: Absent.
Male (from 21 ˚ 20 ’ 22.8 ” S 117 ˚ 15 ’ 36.3 ” E, 2.3 km ESE of Python Pool, SITE PW01, Western Australia , Australia ; WAM T 79403 ):

Colour. Dorsal shield of prosoma uniformly yellow-brown; sternum pale yellow-brown; chelicerae yellowbrown; maxillae pale yellow-brown; opisthosoma missing; legs yellow-brown, annulations not visible.
Prosoma . 0.92 times longer than broad; clypeus 0.18 high.

Eyes . AER slightly recurved; PER recurved; PME larger than AME, PLE largest, ALE smallest; eye group width 1.25 ; eye diameters, AME 0.20 , ALE 0.09 , PME 0.25 , PLE 0.36 ; interdistances AME-ALE 0.29 , PME-PLE 0.29 , ALE-PLE 0.34 , AME-PME 0.02 ; ocular quadrangle AME-AME 0.13 , PME-PME 0.41 .
Sternum. 0.65 times longer than broad.
Chelicerae . Promargin with 2 teeth, retromargin with 1 tooth.
Opisthosoma. Missing.

Legs . Leg I much shorter than legs II, III and IV; leg formula 3241 ; leg III longest; tarsal claws without teeth; spination: leg I, Fm pr 1 - 1 -0, d 1 - 1 - 1 , rl 1 - 1 - 1 ; Ti d 0,
v 2 - 2
- 2 - 2 - 2 ; Mt

- 2 - 2 ; leg II, Fm pr 1 - 1 - 1 , d 1 - 1 - 1 , rl 1 - 1 - 1 ; Ti
v 2 - 2
- 2 - 2 - 2 ; Mt
v 2 - 2
- 2 - 2 ; leg III, Fm pr 1 - 1 - 1 , d 1 - 1 - 1 , rl 1 - 1 - 1 ; Ti 2 - 2 - 2 ; Mt 2 -0; leg IV, Fm pr 0-1 - 1 , d 1 - 1 - 1 , rl 0-1 - 1 ; Ti
v 2 - 2
; Mt
v 2
-0-0.

Measurements. Dorsal shield of prosoma length 2.96 , width 3.21 . Sternum length 0.96 , width 1.48 . Pedipalp: Fm 0.96 , Pt 0.48 , Ti 0.45 , Ta 0.93 , (total) 2.82 . Leg I: Fm 3.56 , Pt 1.43 , Ti 3.51 , Mt 3.46 , Ta 1.25 , (total) 13.21 . Leg II: Fm 4.73 , Pt 1.50 , Ti 4.10 , Mt 4.14 , Ta 1.70 , (total) 16.17 . Leg III: Fm 4.86 , Pt 1.46 , Ti 4.29 , Mt 4.00, Ta 1.67 , (total) 16.28 . Leg IV: Fm 4.68 , Pt 1.25 , Ti 3.76 , Mt 4.39 , Ta 1.63 , (total) 15.71 .
Life history and habitat preferences. Unknown.
Remarks. Colours and patterns may not be typical because of collection in ethylene glycol.
